intro: Duguetia stelechantha, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its dark green, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom at night. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellow berry that contains several seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided by livestock and humans alike.
